title: Supertrait not found
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
trait SpanSource {
    type Span;
}

trait Diagnostics<S>:
    StripSpan<S> + EmitDiag<S, <Self as StripSpan<S>>::Stripped>
{
}

trait StripSpan<S> {
    type Stripped;
}

trait EmitDiag<S, T> {}

trait ParsingContext: SpanSource + Diagnostics<<Self as SpanSource>::Span> {}

trait TokenStreamActions: ParsingContext {
    type InstrLineActions: ParsingContext<Span = Self::Span>;
}
```

I expected to see this happen: it looks like the program should compile as it is, since a type implementing `ParsingContext` implies it implements `StripSpan`. Using the suggested solution in my real program causes an explosion of `where` clauses, so I'd like to avoid it if possible.

Instead, this happened: I get this error message:
```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:18:1
   |
18 |   trait TokenStreamActions: ParsingContext {
   |   ^                                       - help: consider further restricting the associated type: `where <Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>`
   |  _|
   | |
19 | |     type InstrLineActions: ParsingContext<Span = Self::Span>;
20 | | }
   | |_^ the trait `StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not implemented for `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:18:27
   |
18 | trait TokenStreamActions: ParsingContext {
   |                           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^- help: consider further restricting the associated type: `where <Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>`
   |                           |
   |                           the trait `StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not implemented for `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not satisfied
  --> src/lib.rs:19:5
   |
18 | trait TokenStreamActions: ParsingContext {
   |                                         - help: consider further restricting the associated type: `where <Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions: StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>`
19 |     type InstrLineActions: ParsingContext<Span = Self::Span>;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `StripSpan<<Self as SpanSource>::Span>` is not implemented for `<Self as TokenStreamActions>::InstrLineActions`
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.43.1 (8d69840ab 2020-05-04)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 8d69840ab92ea7f4d323420088dd8c9775f180cd
commit-date: 2020-05-04
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.43.1
LLVM version: 9.0
```
